qas.question: What caused Notre Dame to become notable in the early 20th century?
Which 20th century Notre Dame football coach is most notable?
Which athletic association are the student athletes at Notre Dame a part of?
How many students at Notre Dame received the Heisman Trophy?
There were multiple students from Notre Dame who entered the Pro Football Hall of Fame, how many?

context: Notre Dame rose to national prominence in the early 1900s for <a0_0>its Fighting Irish football team<a0_0/>, especially under the guidance of the legendary coach <a1_0>Knute Rockne<a1_0/>. The university's athletic teams are members of the <a2_0>NCAA Division I<a2_0/> and are known collectively as the Fighting Irish. The football team, an Independent, has accumulated eleven consensus national championships, <a3_0>seven<a3_0/> Heisman Trophy winners, 62 members in the College Football Hall of Fame and <a4_0>13<a4_0/> members in the Pro Football Hall of Fame and is considered one of the most famed and successful college football teams in history. Other ND teams, chiefly in the Atlantic Coast Conference, have accumulated 16 national championships. The Notre Dame Victory March is often regarded as the most famous and recognizable collegiate fight song.
